title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that diminishing marginal returns begin with the third worker and/or does not explain that the marginal product (MP) of the third worker (120) is less than the MP of the second worker (130).
The response states that diminishing marginal returns begin with the third worker and explains that the marginal product (MP) of the third worker (120) is less than the MP of the second worker (130).

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the marginal revenue product of the second worker as $390 and/or does not show the work.

The response calculates the marginal revenue product of the second worker as $390 and shows the work.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that 4 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 4th worker ($150) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($140), but the MRP of the 5th worker ($120) is less than the MRC ($140).

The response states that 4 workers will be hired to maximize its profit and explains that the marginal revenue product (MRP) of the 4th worker ($150) is greater than the marginal resource cost (MRC) or wage ($140), but the MRP of the 5th worker ($120) is less than the MRC ($140).

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does none of the following:

· States that the market wage rate will increase and explains that an increase in the cost of the exam will lead to a decrease in the supply of workers in that market.

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market will decrease and explains that the increase in the wage rate resulting from the decrease in the supply of workers in that market will lead to fewer workers hired given the downward-sloping demand curve.

The response does one of the following:

· States that the market wage rate will increase and explains that an increase in the cost of the exam will lead to a decrease in the supply of workers in that market.

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market will decrease and explains that the increase in the wage rate resulting from the decrease in the supply of workers in that market will lead to fewer workers hired given the downward-sloping demand curve.

The response does both of the following:

· States that the market wage rate will increase and explains that an increase in the cost of the exam will lead to a decrease in the supply of workers in that market.

· States that the number of workers hired in the labor market will decrease and explains that the increase in the wage rate resulting from the decrease in the supply of workers in that market will lead to fewer workers hired given the downward-sloping demand curve.
